text: all this week we're doing low-fat

stir-frying
yes most refined recipes are actually

really helpful
today I'm making a shiitake shrimp and
snow peas stir-fry it's really fast
really easy and it's low fat so you're
gonna be happy and so will your body the
first thing you want to do is trim off
these stems of the shiitake those are
not edible you can save them for stock
if you want to and then just cut your
mushrooms into quarters you don't even
need to slice them too thick you want a
nice mouthfeel from these shiitake
mushrooms are great for that they have a
really excellent texture they're
slightly chewy or I guess then a regular
white mushroom I have my pan preheating
I'm using a wok you could use a cast
iron a large cast iron skillet or any
heavy skillet but a wok is fantastic I
had it on a medium low now I'm turning
it up to a high and to that add 2
tablespoons of oil vegetable oil or
safflower is good choice here something
neutral swirl it around in your pan and
then add your mushrooms they need to
cook for about 5 minutes stir it around
once or twice and then while these are
cooking to compact the rest of your
ingredients I have 2 scallions the
recipe says just the green part but I
mean come on Who am I kidding I'm not
gonna save the white part for something
else so I'm just gonna go ahead and use
the whole thing
call me crazy slice those up and then
four ounces of snow peas you want to

just chopping off the ends seems more

you need about a teaspoon so use your

pretty low yields I'm certainly not

then 2 tablespoons of soy sauce
low-sodium or regular spine with me
your choice today and then three
tablespoons of unseasoned rice vinegar
make sure it's the unseasoned the season
has sugar and other flavors in it it's
not what you're looking for quarter
teaspoon of hot pepper flakes it's
optional I suppose if you don't want it
don't use it
add your soy sauce mixture watch it boil
up like crazy
and then very shortly thereafter you can

it's a much better idea than trying to
